clip_assessment.verbatim_quote: Buyers aren't rejecting homes. They reject uncertainty when they don't feel good about something when there's a lack of information.
clip_assessment.guest_voice: Carrie speaks in clear, definitive statements — no hedging. She uses concrete metaphors and frames insights as universal truths backed by decades of pattern recognition.
clip_assessment.why_this_stops_scrolls: It reframes every lost deal as a communication failure, not a pricing problem — which means every agent watching just got handed back control.

HOOK.text: Your buyers aren't walking away from the house. They're walking away from you.
HOOK.production_note: Hard cut to Carrie mid-sentence, tight frame. Text overlay: 'They're walking away from YOU'

SETUP.text: Carrie McCormick — top 1% producer in Chicago luxury — just told me why deals die. And it has nothing to do with the property.
SETUP.production_note: B-roll: Carrie's credentials (top 1%, Chicago skyline). Quick cuts to keep pace.

INSIGHT.text: Here's what she said: 'Buyers don't reject homes. They reject uncertainty.' Here's what that looks like in real life. Carrie's presenting a $2.1M listing. Buyer asks why it's priced there. Weak agent says: 'Market analysis supports it.' Carrie says: 'Two comps closed 90 days ago at $1.95M. Since then, inventory dropped 40% in this zip code. We priced at $2.1M because we're launching with a 72-hour social blitz, broker event Tuesday, and if we don't get action in 10 days, we adjust. Here's the timeline.' One agent gave a number. One gave certainty. Guess who got the listing.
INSIGHT.production_note: Show Carrie speaking the quote. Cut to text overlays: '$2.1M listing' / 'Inventory dropped 40%' / '72-hour blitz' / 'Here's the timeline.' B-roll of listing presentations, data sheets, calendar graphics.

REFRAME.text: So the next time a buyer ghosts after a showing? It's not the house. It's that you gave them a price without a plan. You gave them doubt instead of direction.
REFRAME.production_note: Return to Carrie, slightly wider frame. Text: 'Price without a PLAN.' Slow push-in for emphasis.

CTA.text: Tomorrow morning, take your next listing. Write out three sentences: Why this price. Why this week. What happens in 10 days if we're wrong. Say it out loud before your presentation. That's the script. Full episode in bio.
CTA.production_note: Text overlay: 'Tomorrow morning: Write 3 sentences' / 'Why this price / Why this week / What if we're wrong' / 'Say it OUT LOUD.' End card with podcast branding and 'Link in bio'

caption: Buyers don't reject homes. They reject uncertainty. Carrie McCormick shows exactly what that means in a listing presentation.

_metadata.rewrite_changelog: Replaced vague 'pricing as a narrative' with Carrie's actual $2.1M listing example showing exact comps, inventory data, and marketing timeline. Rewrote CTA from reflective 'ask yourself' to specific morning prep action: write three sentences, say them out loud before next presentation.
_metadata.judge_note: The hook promises a punch but the insight gets vague—show exactly what 'pricing as a narrative' looks like with a real example from Carrie's deals.
